definition: classics/sacred book/scripture/to pass through/to undergo/to bear/to endure/warp (textile)/longitude/menstruation/channel (TCM)/abbr. for economics 經濟|经济[jing1 ji4]
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: The English empiricism aestheticians turn the study of beauty to the subjective of human.
sentences.chinese: 英国经验主义美学家的美学研究转向了人的主观心理。

sentences.english: Because of this, Rorty claims reserve Pragmatism and give up Empiricism.
sentences.chinese: 所以罗蒂主张保留实用主义而把经验主义加以剔除。

sentences.english: But there are different respects in which one can be an empiricist.
sentences.chinese: 不过，经验主义可以体现在不同方面。

sentences.english: Another kind of empiricism has to do with where we get our knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 另一种经验主义与我们从哪里获取知识有关。

sentences.english: From an empiricist point of view, this is a baffling situation.
sentences.chinese: 从经验主义的观点看，这是一个令人困惑的局面。

sentences.english: Locke is a modern age empiricism a generalization of, its thought influence is profound.
sentences.chinese: 洛克是近代经验主义集大成者，其思想影响深远。

sentences.english: It is in this sense that Comte repudiates empiricism.
sentences.chinese: 正是从这个意义上说，孔德抛弃了经验主义。

sentences.english: Before Locke, Becon and Hobbes are two supreme British empiricists.
sentences.chinese: 洛克之前培根和霍布斯堪称英国经验主义双璧。

sentences.english: Action and experimentation are the cornerstones of empiricism.
sentences.chinese: 行动和尝试是经验主义的基石。

sentences.english: OK, so that's one kind of empiricism.
This reason was not full, violates the empiricism to be wrong.
sentences.chinese: 这个理由并不充分，犯了经验主义错误。

definition: epistemology (in philosophy, the theory of how we know things)
agnosticism, the philosophical doctrine that some questions about the universe are in principle unanswerable
philosophy of idealism, the doctrine that external reality is a product of consciousness
materialism, philosophical doctrine that physical matter is the whole of reality
philosophy of idealism, the doctrine that external reality is a product of consciousness
